title: Instructions Synchronization
description:
Instructions parser with @include support, conditional block support (@if(platform)), sync logic with diff detection, dry-run mode, validation.

**Deliverables:** `aix instructions sync|validate|diff`

title: Config File Atomic Writes
description:
- Write-to-temp + atomic rename pattern
- Handle interrupted writes gracefully
- Tests for write failure scenarios

title: Path Resolution Utilities
description:
- XDG-compliant paths on Linux (XDG_CONFIG_HOME, XDG_DATA_HOME)
- Proper macOS paths (~/.config/aix or ~/Library/Application Support)
- Handle missing directories gracefully (create with proper permissions)
- Unit tests across path scenarios

title: Platform Interface Definition
description:
- Define Platform interface in internal/platform/platform.go per ADR
- Include all methods: Name, ConfigDirs, Install/Uninstall/List for skills/commands/MCP
- TranslateVariables, ValidateSkill, IsAvailable, Version
- Godoc documentation for each method
- Test helpers for platform adapter implementers

title: OpenCode Platform Adapter
description: Implement OpenCodePlatform adapter for ~/.config/opencode/ config locations, AGENTS.md instructions, opencode.json MCP config, skill/command directory management.

title: CLI Foundation Infrastructure
description:
Core internal libraries for aix CLI: config management, path resolution, Platform interface, frontmatter parser, logging, and error handling. This is the foundational layer that platform adapters and CLI commands depend on.

**Deliverables:**
- internal/config/ - Config file schema, validation, management
- internal/platform/ - Platform interface definition and registry
- pkg/frontmatter/ - YAML frontmatter parser for skills/commands
- Structured logging (slog-based)
- Error handling conventions

**Out of Scope (separate epics):**
- CLI commands (aix init, aix config) - see CLI Commands epic
- Platform adapters - separate epics per platform

title: Error Handling Conventions
description:
- Define sentinel errors in each package (ErrNotFound, ErrInvalidConfig, etc.)
- Error wrapping conventions with context
- User-facing error messages vs debug details separation
- Document conventions in AGENTS.md or CONTRIBUTING.md

title: CLI Commands (init, config, version)
description:
User-facing CLI commands that consume the foundation infrastructure.

**Deliverables:**
- aix init - Bootstrap aix configuration with platform detection
- aix config - View and modify configuration (get/set/list/edit subcommands)  
- aix version - Enhanced version output with platform info

**Dependencies:** Requires CLI Foundation Infrastructure (aix-5wq) to be complete.

**User Experience:**
- aix init: Interactive mode (prompts) and non-interactive mode (flags)
- aix config: Subcommands for get, set, list, edit
- aix version: Show version, commit, date, Go version, detected platforms

title: Frontmatter Parser
description:
- Create pkg/frontmatter/ package
- Parse YAML frontmatter from markdown files (--- delimited)
- Handle missing frontmatter gracefully (return nil, not error)
- Return typed structs for skill/command metadata
- Unit tests with various frontmatter scenarios

title: aix init Command
description:
- Create ~/.config/aix/config.yaml with sensible defaults
- Detect installed platforms and add to default_platforms
- Interactive mode: prompt for platform selection, preferences
- Non-interactive mode: --yes flag for defaults, --platforms flag for explicit list
- Non-destructive: warn and exit if config exists (--force to overwrite)
- Unit tests with filesystem mocking

title: CLI Hardening & Telemetry
description:
Deferred work for CLI robustness and analytics. Not blocking for initial release.

**Deliverables:**
- Config file atomic writes (data integrity)
- Platform config backup strategy (safety net)
- Anonymous usage telemetry (opt-in analytics)

**When to prioritize:** After initial CLI is functional and before production release.

title: Cross-Platform Translation
description:
Variable translation ($ARGUMENTS ↔ {{argument}}), YAML ↔ TOML conversion, integrate translation into all installation paths.

**Note:** Foundational for Gemini adapter but also enhances existing adapters.

title: Usage Telemetry
description:
- Anonymous, opt-in usage analytics
- Track: commands used, platforms configured, error rates
- Clear opt-in/opt-out in aix init and aix config
- Privacy-respecting: no PII, no config contents
- Document what's collected

title: aix config Subcommands
description:
- aix config get <key> - dot-notation key lookup (e.g., platforms.claude.global_config)
- aix config set <key> <value> - update config value
- aix config list - show all configuration
- aix config edit - open config in $EDITOR
- Validation on set operations
- Unit tests for each subcommand

title: Slash Command Management
description:
Command parser, installation/removal logic, listing, platform-specific command directory handling.

**Deliverables:** `aix cmd install|list|remove|show`

title: Codex Platform Adapter
description: Research Codex config format and MCP support, implement CodexPlatform adapter for ~/.codex/ locations, CODEX.md/AGENTS.md instructions.

title: aix version Enhancement
description:
- Show version, commit SHA, build date (existing)
- Add Go version
- Add list of detected platforms with availability status
- Unit tests

title: Skill Registry Ecosystem
description:
Design registry API specification, implement registry client, search functionality, version resolution, dependency resolution.

**Deliverables:** `aix skill search|install @scope/name`

**Note:** Future enhancement - deferred to post-v1.0.

title: Structured Logging Setup
description:
- slog-based logging infrastructure
- Support debug/info/warn/error levels
- --verbose flag wiring in root command
- AIX_DEBUG=1 environment variable support
- Consistent log format (text for TTY, JSON option for pipes)

title: Production Readiness
description:
Implement `aix doctor` diagnostics, `aix status` overview, shell completions (bash, zsh, fish), user documentation.

**Deliverables:** `aix doctor`, `aix status`, shell completions, docs

title: Platform Backup Strategy
description:
- Backup original platform configs before first aix modification
- Timestamped backups in ~/.config/aix/backups/
- aix restore command or flag to restore from backup
- Document backup/restore process

title: Release Engineering
description: CI/CD pipeline for releases, installation scripts, Homebrew formula, goreleaser config, v1.0.0 release preparation.

title: Config File Schema & Validation
description:
Define YAML schema for ~/.config/aix/config.yaml
- Implement validation with clear error messages including line numbers
- Support version field for future migrations
- Unit tests with valid/invalid config fixtures

title: Platform Registry & Detection
description:
- Registry pattern for platform adapter registration
- IsAvailable() detection logic (check for config dir + binary)
- List detected/available platforms
- Unit tests with mock platforms

title: Claude Platform Adapter
description: Implement ClaudePlatform adapter for ~/.claude/ config locations, CLAUDE.md instructions, mcp_servers.json, settings.json, skill/command directory management.

title: MCP Server Lifecycle
description:
MCP config schema, server addition with env vars, SSE transport support, enable/disable per platform, server removal, listing with status.

**Deliverables:** `aix mcp add|remove|enable|disable|list|show`

title: Gemini Platform Adapter
description: Implement GeminiPlatform adapter for ~/.gemini/ locations, GEMINI.md instructions, TOML config format, {{variable}} syntax translation.

title: Skill Lifecycle Management
description:
SKILL.md parser with frontmatter, tool permission parser/validator, local path installation, git repository installation, skill removal/listing/inspection, `aix skill init` scaffolding.

**Deliverables:** `aix skill install|list|remove|validate|init|show`
